formalpara.title: Figure 4. Epidermal enclosure
formalpara.para: Schematics (left column, A-D), Nomarski images (middle column, E-H, ventral view; see also ) and DLG-1::GFP images (right column, I-L, ventral view; see also ) of ventral enclosure. Different embryos, at corresponding developmental stages, are shown in middle and right columns. Scale bar = 5 μm. Ventral cells are shown in pink in the left-hand column; seam epidermal cells in yellow, and dorsal cells, which wrap around the tail, in teal. Neuroblasts and other internal cells are depicted in gray. The first two pairs of ventral cells to reach the ventral midline are termed "leading cells" (Williams-Masson et al., 1997), which extend long protrusions towards the midline (B). After the leading cells make contact at the ventral midline, cells posterior to these cells, termed "pocket cells" (Williams-Masson et al., 1997), reach the midline (C). Finally, the anterior epidermal cells enclose the head (D).
